column4: hey. sometimes the screen starts to flicker and the colors gets strange. what can that be?
is you monitor cable plugged in all the way...I had that problem
i've got a laptop and I surpose the cable should be fine. it haven't happened before in windows
lol...probably is if it is a laptop
have another clue about what can be wrong?
do you have the correct drivers?
I use the driver found here in lack of drivers made by SIS: http://www.winischhofer.eu/linuxsisvga.shtml
does it only happen in gui?
it doesn't happen often so I don't know if it will happen without gui
it just freaks out every so often?
could you do me a favour and read some of this http://www.winischhofer.eu/linuxsispart1.shtml#13 and see it that have something to do with my problem?
yep...
I don't know.  What is your screen res?
try decreasing it and see if that helps.  if so, you probably don't hav the independent video ram
it said something about dedicated local video memory. do you know what that is?
yes.  its when a video card has its own memory onboard.  shared video memory means that it uses the system memory, and must use the system bus to use it (ie. slow).
my laptop has that junk....shared memory
do you know how I can check wherether my pc uses dedicated local video memory?
if you know the model number of the laptop, google it.
it used shared video memory
I figured.
that means that there was a problem with the video card and the driver. crap!
I feel your pain
